speaker: Forge
lines: You step into the forge. Heat rolls out from the hearth.
You hear steady hammer blows and see the anvil shine.
You pass racks of tools hung within easy reach.
You notice a quench trough steaming beside the hearth.
The smith glances up and nods for you to speak.
Blades rest on a rack, edges covered in oil.
A childâ€™s drawing of a sword hangs on the wall.
'Looking for work or a commission?' the smith asks.

choices.text: Step to the counter and speak business.
Walk the forge floor and watch the work.
Ask the apprentices what they whisper when the bellows sigh.
